key_title: Key to the genera of Plantaginaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

leads.lead_text: Perianth absent or of 1 whorl, or of 2 or more similar whorls (sometimes falling off as an operculum at anthesis); prostrate or floating aquatics or semi-aquatic herbs with distinctly opposite leaves; fruit more or less circular, dividing into 4 semicircular mericarps

Perianth of 2 distinct whorls (sepals and petals), differing from each other in shape, size or colour (calyx or corolla sometimes deciduous at anthesis); if ever aquatic, leaves radical or appearing so
Petals translucent, colourless or brownish; inflorescence of a spike, the fertile part rarely more than 30 cm long (usually much less)
Petals white or coloured, not translucent; inflorescence various, but if ever a spike, the fertile part usually longer than 30 cm
Bracteoles present (between bract or leaf and calyx)
Bracteoles absent
Fertile stamens 4, staminodes absent or present; corolla 2-lipped, blue to purple
Fertile stamens 2, sometimes with staminodes; corolla cylindric, pale to rosy pink or white
Stamens 2; calyx and corolla 4- or 5-(rarely 6-)merous, the corolla c. equally lobed
Stamens 5 or 4; calyx and corolla 5-merous, the corolla usually unequally lobed (but more or less equally lobed in Limosella and Digitalis)
Stem leaves alternate (if opposite in lower parts, leaves broad-ovate)
Stem leaves opposite (at least in lower parts), linear to narrow-elliptic
Corolla closed at mouth by palate on lower side, the base of the tube spurred on lower side
Corolla mouth open, with or without palate, the tube symmetrical at base
Leaves with lamina entire or with a pair of large basal lobes, pinnately veined; cap- sules dehiscing by an apical pore or irregular longitudinal slits
Leaves reniform to semicircular, with 5–9 rounded to triangular lobes, palmately veined; capsules dehiscing by irregular longitudinal apical slits
Plants procumbent to ascending; leaves petiolate; flowers solitary; capsules dehisc- ing by an apical pore covered by a detachable lid
Plants erect; leaves sessile; flowers in terminal racemes or spikes; capsules dehisc- ing by irregular longitudinal slits
[link through]
Erect herb; leaves c. ovate, usually crowded at base; inflorescence a terminal spike- like raceme
Tender twiner or climber; leaves c. triangular, cordate or hastate at base, not crowded at base; flowers solitary in axils
